components.text:
The invisible hand of technology

Learn More »

pages.name: about
pages.text:
About ThoughtWave Technologies

Company History

ThoughtWave Technologies, Inc. was founded in 1994 in a suburban Detroit basement, originally as a software development consulting company. In January of that year, we were assigned priceless Class C internet address space, and later that year created our first website. Our first server was an offbrand homebuilt 486-DX running Linux 1.0.6. Now 25 years later, we are still an independent company with a physical server presence on the internet, using our own IP addresses, which is virtually unheard of for any company formed after 1999.

We have servers in several locations including Los Angeles, Miami, and Detroit. We have BGP connectivity to the Internet as ASN 54380. We offer IPv4 as well as IPv6 native connectivity.

Core Competencies

Every consultant and developer hired by ThoughtWave Technologies is a perfectionist fixated on making technology do great things, while at the same time understanding the underlying business logic. We offer services ranging from plain-old UNIX and Linux System Administration, to DevOps, and INFOSEC, as well as mobile application development and project management. Our founder has cut his hands many times changing memory DIMMs on servers, but also knows how to tie a tie.

  • Linux
  • UNIX
  • Networking
  • Software Development
  • Process Engineering
  • DevOps
  • Continuous Integration
  • Start-up Advising
  • Budget Optimization
  • Cloud Management

Tech That We Like

We like Linux. Our preferred flavor is Ubuntu, but that doesn't mean we can't handle your Red Hat needs. We can build you a great continuous integration system using Jenkins and GitHub, and have it roll out your applications into the Amazon, Azure, or Google Cloud, or run them on your own servers. We also do UNIX, as in Sun Solaris. If you've never heard of it, then don't worry about it, but if you need someone to manage your Oracle Database Server running any version of Solaris from 2.5.1 to Oracle Solaris 11.4, we got this.

pages.name: devops
pages.text:
DevOps Services

Do you honestly need to hire a full time DevOps person? If you do, there are many staffing agencies who will charge you $35,000 in a finders fee to hire someone who you will then have to pay $150,000 to $160,000 a year. If that doesn't sound like a nightmare, you're probably better off hiring someone directly. Our philosophy is different from how the staffing agencies and consulting agencies work. The fact is, you may have one or two areas where you need help, but you don't want to hire a costly hourly consultant. We offer several packages of what we like to call cafeteria-style DevOps. What this means is that you can pick and choose what services you want, pay a weekly flat rate, and get expertise in those particular services without having to worry about hiring.

Cloud Account Weekly Audit - $50

You don't need to spend a lot of money having someone go through and audit your usage and capacity planning. We'll have a real human being, or a sufficiently intelligent cyborg, review your Amazon Web Services account, checking for things like database security patches that need to be applied, upcoming events, and cost alarms, so that you can worry about making your app work properly.

Jenkins Build Server Weekly Support - $250

Your continuous integration system keeps you in the game, so why should a failed build due to a misconfiguration sideline you? Why should a memory error prevent your automatic deployment from completing? We'll figure out which modules to install to customize and manage your Jenkins CI server. We'll get your automatic builds working again, help with capacity planning and make sure you don't lose valuable developer time to failing builds.

GitHub Account Weekly Support - $200

We'll manage all the aspects of adding and removing users from your GitHub account, tracking branches that aren't in use any more, creating and removing repositories and helping with various integrations such as WebHooks and Jenkins builds. This may also be used to manage your on-site Git server or a cloud-based one if you have it. Merge conflicts aren't included with this package, because those are hard to fix.

OpsWorks / Elastic Beanstalk Stack Weekly Support - $175

We'll manage one OpsWorks or Elastic Beanstalk stack. This includes troubleshooting instance issues, working with autoscaling, re-deploying applications, supporting Jenkins automatic deploys to Beanstalk, upgrades, patches, CloudWatch alarms, cloning environments, help with recipes and .ebextenions, and deploying rolling patches. We'll also train you on best practices to make these easier to manage.

pages.name: cloud
pages.text:
Cloud Services & Hosting

Monthly Linux VM - $50

We manage our own OpenStack Cloud and have a single Linux VM offering. It includes 4 cores, and 4GB of RAM as well as 40GB of disk space. You can choose from several different OS choices. This includes reasonable Q&A and basic support for installing software and performing troubleshooting. This includes reverse DNS configuration.

Monthly Solaris VM - $159

We are one of the few providers that offers Oracle Solaris SPARC VMs. This includes 1GB of RAM and 1 CPU thread along with 20GB of disk space. Your system will include the latest available Solaris Operating system. This is a semi-managed solution, meaning we'll install the operating system and help with basic configuration. You are responsible for ensuring that you have a valid Oracle support contract if you intend to use this for commercial operations. This includes reverse DNS configuration.

Monthly Bare Metal Server from ThoughtWave Direct

Do you need dedicated hardware to run your application? Are multi-tenant like AWS (Amazon Web Services) too risky and not cost-effective enough for you? Get an 8-core server with 24GB of RAM and 1TB of disk space starting at only $99/month including support. Plans with live transfer are available for an additional fee.

pages.name: expertise
pages.text:
Consulting & Managed Services

How Can We Help?

If you're looking to put together a team for your short term or immediate needs, we can help you with that. In fact, if you are early stage and don't have seed funding, we may be able to work out an equity arrangement depending on how good your idea is.

Weekly IT / DevOps Support - $1200

Do you need an on-call person who can handle all of your support needs? Do you need someone who can interact with your developers on slack and help them debug and troubleshoot your apps? Do you need someone who can migrate large pools of data from one location ot another? Do you need someone who can help you troubleshoot software errors, patch servers, and deal with user access issues? You'll get someone stateside who can help with everything you need. Call +1 310 317 7933 for more information

CTO-for-Hire

Our founder has made himself available for limited engagements at a reasonable monthly rate to help new startups build their technology departments and obtain venture funding. For a flat monthly rate, you'll get business advisory services including help drawing up job descriptions for technologists, help developing vendor selection criteria, and help designing workflows for continuous integration, scrum, and operations support. You'll also get someone who can work a room and charm investors if necessary. The first week is free, to give both parties an opportunity to evaluate the situation.

Jonathan Kalbfeld

former NASA guy

components.name: contact
components.submit_code:
Meteor.call('sendMail', { from: values.email, to: 'support@thoughtwave.net', subject: 'ThoughtWave Message from ' + values.name, text: values.message }, function(e) {  if(e) errorAction(e.message); else submitAction('Your message is sent. Thank you for contacting us! :)'); } );
Meteor.call('sendMail', { from: 'support@thoughtwave.net', to: 'support@thoughtwave.net', subject: 'ThoughtWave Message from ' + values.name, text: values.email + ' ' + values.message }, function(e) {  if(e) errorAction(e.message); else submitAction('Your message is sent. Thank you for contacting us! :)'); } );
components.title: Contact

components.name: support_id
components.text:
Message to Support

{{userFullName}}, you can enter a message in the box below and it will be sent to support. Someone will reply to you at {{userEmail}}. Please note, if you have a support contract, you will be able to dial directly or reach us on Slack, which is much quicker.

components.name: support_form

Meteor.call('sendMail', { from: 'support@thoughtwave.net', to: 'support@thoughtwave.net', subject: 'Support Message from ' + values.name, text: values.email + ' ' + values.message }, function(e) {  if(e) errorAction(e.message); else submitAction('Your message is sent. Thank you for contacting us! :)'); } );
